description: The UPS output power will turn off in a number of
seconds equal to upsControlOutputOffTrapDelay.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdControlOff XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID i 9999 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE

description: A unique identifier for an alarm condition.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID

description: A reference to an alarm description object. The object
referenced should not be accessible, but rather be used to
provide a unique description of the alarm condition.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr

description: A descriptive text message which may be sent with traps to
further explain the reason for the trap.
This object is not-accessible to MIB browsers, but had to be changed to
read-only to satisfy SMIv2 syntax checkers since it is included in traps.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage

description: The UPS output power will turn on in a number of
seconds equal to upsControlOutputOnTrapDelay.

description: A test is in progress, as initiated and indicated by the xupsTest Group.
When the test is complete, one of the following traps will be sent:
- xupstdDiagnosticTestFailed if the test fails
- xupstdDiagnosticTestPassed on success, or
- xupstdAlarmEntryRemoved in other cases (e.g., Test Canceled).
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdAlarmTestInProgress XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID i 9999 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE

description: The ambient temperature, xupsEnvAmbientTemp, has fallen below
the set lower limit, xupsEnvAmbientLowerLimit, or has risen above
the set upper limit, xupsEnvAmbientUpperLimit.

Summary.eval: ($v3 ne '') ? '$v3' : (($v4 < $v5) ? 'Ambient temperature is too low' : 'Ambient temperature is too high')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdAmbientTempBad XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID i 9999 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE XUPS-MIB::xupsEnvAmbientTemp i -60 XUPS-MIB::xupsEnvAmbientLowerLimit i -50 XUPS-MIB::xupsEnvAmbientUpperLimit i 50

description: A unique identifier for an alarm condition.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID

description: A reference to an alarm description object. The object
referenced should not be accessible, but rather be used to
provide a unique description of the alarm condition.

description: A descriptive text message which may be sent with traps to
further explain the reason for the trap.
This object is not-accessible to MIB browsers, but had to be changed to
read-only to satisfy SMIv2 syntax checkers since it is included in traps.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage

description: The reading of the ambient temperature in the vicinity of the
UPS or SNMP agent.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsEnvAmbientTemp

description: The Lower Limit of the ambient temperature; if xupsEnvAmbientTemp
falls below this value, the xupsAmbientTempBad alarm will occur.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsEnvAmbientLowerLimit

description: The Upper Limit of the ambient temperature; if xupsEnvAmbientTemp
rises above this value, the xupsAmbientTempBad alarm will occur.
This value should be greater than xupsEnvAmbientLowerLimit.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsEnvAmbientUpperLimit

description: The Contact indicated by xupsContactIndex is in its Active state.
The following are the situations that generate this trap:
For xupsContactType: and xupsContactState:
normallyOpen(1) and closedWithNotice(4)
normallyClosed(2) and openWithNotice(3)
anyChange(3) and openWithNotice(3) or closedWithNotice(4)
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdContactActiveNotice EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactIndex i 1 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactType i 1 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactState i 1 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactDescr s EXAMPLE

description: The Contact identifier; identical to the Contact Number.
This object is not-accessible to MIB browsers, but had to be changed to
read-only to satisfy SMIv2 syntax checkers if it is included in traps.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactIndex

description: The normal state for this contact. The 'other' (not 'Normally')
state is the Active state for generating the xupstdContactActiveNotice
trap. If anyChange(3) is selected, then this trap is sent
any time the contact changes to either Open or Closed.
No traps are sent if the Contact is set to notUsed(4).
In many cases, the configuration for Contacts may be done by other
means, so this object may be read-only.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactType

description: The current state of the Contact input;
the value is based on the open/closed input state
and the setting for xupsContactType.
When entering the openWithNotice(3) and closedWithNotice(4)
states, no entries added to the xupsAlarmTable, but
the xupstdContactActiveNotice trap is sent.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactState

description: A label identifying the Contact. This object should be
set by the administrator.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactDescr

description: The Contact indicated by xupsContactIndex has changed to its Inactive state.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdContactInactiveNotice EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactIndex i 1 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactType i 1 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactState i 1 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactDescr s EXAMPLE

description: The Contact identifier; identical to the Contact Number.
This object is not-accessible to MIB browsers, but had to be changed to
read-only to satisfy SMIv2 syntax checkers if it is included in traps.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactIndex

description: The normal state for this contact. The 'other' (not 'Normally')
state is the Active state for generating the xupstdContactActiveNotice
trap. If anyChange(3) is selected, then this trap is sent
any time the contact changes to either Open or Closed.
No traps are sent if the Contact is set to notUsed(4).
In many cases, the configuration for Contacts may be done by other
means, so this object may be read-only.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactType

description: The current state of the Contact input;
the value is based on the open/closed input state
and the setting for xupsContactType.
When entering the openWithNotice(3) and closedWithNotice(4)
states, no entries added to the xupsAlarmTable, but
the xupstdContactActiveNotice trap is sent.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactState

description: A label identifying the Contact. This object should be
set by the administrator.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsContactDescr

description: The system is being powered by its Alternate Power Source, such as a
Secondary utility feed (on a dual AC input UPS), generator, flywheel
or fuel cell.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdOnAlternatePowerSource XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID i 9999 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE XUPS-MIB::xupsInputSource i 1

description: A reference to an alarm description object. The object
referenced should not be accessible, but rather be used to

description: A descriptive text message which may be sent with traps to

This object is not-accessible to MIB browsers, but had to be changed to
read-only to satisfy SMIv2 syntax checkers since it is included in traps.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage

description: The present external source of input power. The enumeration
'none(2)' indicates that there is no external source of
power, for example, the UPS is On Battery (an internal source).
'primaryUtility' indicates the normal case of utility input power.
The 'bypassFeed' can only be used when the Bypass source is known
to be a separate utility feed than the primaryUtility(3).
'secondaryUtility' indicates that a secondary utility feed is supplying
power (on a dual AC input UPS).
'generator' indicates that input power is provided by a generator.
Note that the alternate energy sources of 'flywheel' and 'fuelcell' are
not necessarily AC input sources.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsInputSource

description: On systems with a separate alternate power source (eg, dual AC inputs)
that alternate power source is currently not available. This could be
a problem if the primary power source (eg, utility) fails for a period
of time longer than that for which the internal batteries can supply power.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdAltPowerNotAvailable XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID i 9999 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE

description: The remote temperature, xupsEnvRemoteTemp, has fallen below
the set lower limit, xupsEnvRemoteTempLowerLimit, or has risen above
the set upper limit, xupsEnvRemoteTempUpperLimit.

Summary.eval: ($v3 ne '') ? '$v3' : (($v4 < $v5) ? 'Remote temperature is too low' : 'Remote temperature is too high')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdRemoteTempBad XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID i 9999 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteTemp i 200 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteTempLowerLimit i -100 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteTempUpperLimit i 100

description: A unique identifier for an alarm condition.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID

description: A reference to an alarm description object. The object
referenced should not be accessible, but rather be used to

variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage

description: The reading of an EMP's temperature sensor.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteTemp

description: The Lower Limit of the EMP temperature; if xupsEnvRemoteTemp
falls below this value, the xupsRemoteTempBad alarm will occur.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteTempLowerLimit

description: The Upper Limit of the EMP temperature; if xupsEnvRemoteTemp
rises above this value, the xupsRemoteTempBad alarm will occur.
This value should be greater than xupsEnvRemoteTempLowerLimit.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteTempUpperLimit

description: The remote temperature, xupsEnvRemoteHumidity, has fallen below
the set lower limit, xupsEnvRemoteHumidityLowerLimit, or has risen above
the set upper limit, xupsEnvRemoteHumidityUpperLimit.

Summary.eval: ($v3 ne '') ? '$v3' : (($v4 < $v5) ? 'Remote humidity is too low' : 'Remote humidity is too high')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdRemoteHumidityBad XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID i 9999 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteHumidity i 80 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteHumidityLowerLimit i 25 EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteHumidityUpperLimit i 75

variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteHumidity

description: The Lower Limit of the EMP humidity reading; if xupsEnvRemoteHumidity
falls below this value, the xupsRemoteHumidityBad alarm will occur.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteHumidityLowerLimit

description: The Upper Limit of the EMP humidity reading; if xupsEnvRemoteHumidity
rises above this value, the xupsRemoteHumidityBad alarm will occur.
This value should be greater than xupsEnvRemoteHumidityLowerLimit.
variables.name: EATON-EMP-MIB::xupsEnvRemoteHumidityUpperLimit

description: A periodic status trap message. It is sent at an interval
set by object xupsHeartbeatMinsInterval.
The included variables provide a brief statement of the UPS status.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdHeartbeat XUPS-MIB::xupsInputSource i 1 XUPS-MIB::xupsOutputSource i 1 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarms u 9999

description: The present external source of input power. The enumeration
'none(2)' indicates that there is no external source of
power, for example, the UPS is On Battery (an internal source).
'primaryUtility' indicates the normal case of utility input power.
The 'bypassFeed' can only be used when the Bypass source is known
to be a separate utility feed than the primaryUtility(3).
'secondaryUtility' indicates that a secondary utility feed is supplying
power (on a dual AC input UPS).
'generator' indicates that input power is provided by a generator.
Note that the alternate energy sources of 'flywheel' and 'fuelcell' are
not necessarily AC input sources.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsInputSource

description: The present source of output power. The enumeration
none(2) indicates that there is no source of output
power (and therefore no output power), for example
the system has opened the output breaker.
'normal', 'bypass', and 'battery' indicate those common UPS statuses.
'booster' and 'reducer' indicate boost or buck operation, for
line-interactive UPSs only.
'parallelCapacity' and 'parallelRedundant' indicate a normal parallel
UPS system, in either Parallel for Capacity or Redundancy configuration.
'highEfficiencyMode' is normal but enhanced by High Efficiency mode.
'maintenanceBypass' indicates that the UPS is in Maintenance/Manual
Bypass mode.
'essMode' is normal but enhanced by Energy Saver System.
'other' covers any other, unusual conditions.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsOutputSource

description: The current number of alarm conditions.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarms

description: A diagnostic test just completed, and its result is Passed.
The included variables provide additional information on the test.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdDiagnosticTestPassed XUPS-MIB::xupsTestBatteryStatus i 1 XUPS-MIB::xupsLastGeneralTest i 2 XUPS-MIB::xupsLastGeneralTestResult i 1

description: Reading this enumerated value gives an indication of the (last)
UPS Battery test status.
'inhibited' means that the battery test could not be run.
'scheduled' means that the battery test could not be run at the time
of request, but will be run at some later (UPS-determined) time.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsTestBatteryStatus

description: Indicates the last UPS test requested via xupsTestStart or by other
non-SNMP means, other than for the testBattery (1) case.
The results of the test indicated by this object are reported in
xupsLastGeneralTestResult.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsLastGeneralTest

description: Reading this enumerated value gives the result of the test indicated
in xupsLastGeneralTest.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsLastGeneralTestResult

description: The output condition (other than OutputOverload) is out of tolerance.

Summary.eval: ($v3 ne '') ? '$v3' : 'Output condition is out of tolerance'

description: A reference to an alarm description object. The object
referenced should not be accessible, but rather be used to
provide a unique description of the alarm condition.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr

description: A descriptive text message which may be sent with traps to
further explain the reason for the trap.
This object is not-accessible to MIB browsers, but had to be changed to
read-only to satisfy SMIv2 syntax checkers since it is included in traps.
variables.name: XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage

description: An emergency power off occured.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdEmergencySwitchOff XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmID i 9999 XUPS-MIB::xupsAlarmDescr o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE

description: This trap is sent to the trap receivers to check proper reception of traps.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD XUPS-MIB::xupstdTestTrap RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE XUPS-MIB::xupsTrapMessage s EXAMPLE

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysName

description: A descriptive text message which may be sent with traps to
